title: Hyatt Centric Soalteemode Kathmandu officially debuts in Nepal
description: Hyatt Centric Soalteemode Kathmandu invites modern travelers to discover the vibrant essence of Nepal’s capital city through contemporary design, art, and unique experiences.
author: Post Report

title: Beijing promises to send more tourists to Nepal. But how?
description: Chinese diplomats tell top tour operators they intend to bring at least 500,000 visitors from China this year.
author: Sangam Prasain

title: Interest-free loans draw youths to entrepreneurship
description: Rampur municipality provides interest subsidies for agriculture, livestock, fisheries, and beekeeping for youth entrepreneurs.
author: Madhav Aryal

title: Nepal hauls historic paddy harvest amid harsh climate events
description: Production is expected to grow by 4.04 percent this fiscal year, reaching a new high of 5.95 million tonnes.
author: Sangam Prasain

title: NEPSE this week
description: Here is a snapshot of what happened at the stock market this week.
author: Post Report

title: Top court asks government to fast-track legislation to govern ride-hailing services
description: According to the full text released by the Supreme Court, ride-hailing services are rapidly becoming a popular potential alternative to public transit as consumers value availability, hassle-free, time efficiency and accessibility.
author: Post Report

title: Hospitality industry contributes Rs326 billion to Nepal’s economy
description: A new survey shows 142,223 establishments directly employ 106,459 individuals.
author: Post Report

title: Digital payment is changing Nepal
description: Although Covid-19 gave digital payments a nudge, an overwhelming number of transactions in the country are still cash-based.
author: Krishana Prasain

title: Success stories from the field—and the farm
description: The outmigration of men has led to the feminisation of rural communities where women are increasingly shouldering farming responsibilities.
author: Sangam Prasain

title: Bandipur launches first Visit Bandipur Year campaign
description: The campaign, which will begin on January 1, aims to preserve and develop natural and cultural heritage while promoting responsible tourism activities.
author: Post Report

title: Large cardamom prices soar amid Ramadan demand
description: One of the world’s most expensive spices was traded at Rs2,800 per kg in Birtamode, Jhapa, the key trading hub, last week.
author: Post Report

title: Startups to get state-subsidised loans in March
description: According to the startup enterprise credit operation work procedure, prospective startups will get loans up to Rs2.5 million at 3 percent annual interest.
author: Post Report

title: Tourists in Bhairahawa wait hours at immigration
description: On November 3, the immigration office at Belahiya forced around 800 tourists to wait 7–8 hours for visas. No improvement in the situation.
author: Madhav Dhungana

title: Government introduces policy to boost MCSEs
description: The new policy prioritises utilising knowledge and skills from returnee migrant workers.
author: Post Report

title: NEPSE this week
description: Here is a snapshot of what happened at the stock market this week.
author: Post Report

title: How the shady Airbus A330 jets deal was orchestrated
description: The US-based AAR obtained business by bribing Nepali officials. It has agreed to pay more than $55 million to resolve probes over foreign corruption links.
author: Sangam Prasain

title: Bandana Sharma honoured with Ncell Woman ICON ICT award
description: Every year, this award is presented to a woman who has made remarkable contributions to Nepal’s ICT sector.
author: Post Report

title: Questions hang over hotels’ single-use plastic ban plan
description: Hotel Association pledged to replace bottles by January 1 but target looks beyond reach for many struggling hotels.
author: Sangam Prasain

title: Paddy areas shrink in Karnali as disease, low irrigation take a toll
description: Most farmers engaged in growing paddy are now lured into cash crops such as apples and vegetables.
author: Tripti Shahi

title: Ncell Foundation’s ‘4 for 4s’ initiative ensures more than 2,600 educational kits
description: Each kit to be provided to students will include essential items such as school bags, notebooks, pencils, sharpeners, erasers, and more.
author: Post Report
